intro: Craibiodendron forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese holly or forest holly, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is known for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance. It has limited cultivation outside its native habitat due to its specific ecological requirements. Craibiodendron forrestii is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
